intro: Euonymus japonicus f. macrophyllus, commonly known as the Japanese Spurge, is a variant of the Euonymus japonicus species, characterized by its large, ovate to elliptical leaves. It is a shrub native to Japan and is known for its glossy, dark green foliage that remains throughout the growing season. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by orange-red蒴果 (capsules) that split open to reveal bright red seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. Euonymus japonicus f. macrophyllus prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for both garden landscapes and container planting.
